profile.name: Brais
profile.title: Web Developer Student - / Ruby on Rails / - / postgreSQL / - / HMTL5 / - / CSS3 / - / Bootstrap / - / TailWind / - / JavaScript / - / PHP / - / Docker / - / Linux /
profile.description:
I love web development and programming! ❤ 
The more I know, the more I want to know. At the same time I am able to enjoy the journey immensely. I love what I do.

location.notes: Autocompleted using Google Maps API (id: ChIJi7xhMnjjQgwR7KNoB5Qs7KY)

interestingFacts.topic: I have decided to specialize in Ruby on Rails
interestingFacts.fact:
I have small projects in my Github on this technology, but nothing serious yet.
I have recently started a personal project that I am very excited about and with which I hope to learn as well as teach! I want to build a blog about Ruby on Rails in which I will upload articles and tutorials teaching (and at the same time learning more and more about the framework).

Luckily I have by my side a great friend who is a Senior Developer in Ruby on Rails, and he is guiding and helping me a lot!

I am totally committed to this goal, I want to work on Rails and get to mastery.

If I dont know something, I don't have any kind of problem with start learning something new!
I'm very self-taught.

challenges.description: Backend developer working in a German fintech. Using all kind of modern technologies like distributed systems, Graphql, event sourcing, CQRS, RabbitMQ, etc.

Durante este periodo he podido gestionar el servicio de comercial de ventas de productos industriales de limpieza. Habiendo satisfecho con éxito las siguientes exigencias:
- Gestión de inventario
- Gestión de pedidos
- Atención al cliente
- Visitas a clientes
- Apertura de mercado (visitas a puerta fría)
- Reparto de mercancía
- Elaboración de catálogos
- Elaboración de campañas de publicidad en RRSS

Este puesto ha conseguido sacarme de mi zona de confort, pues aún habiendo tenido mucha experiencia de cara al público me ha forzado a profesionalizarme y formarme en un sector totalmente desconocido por mi hasta ese entonces.
He tenido que apender tanto sobre productos químicos de limpieza, como sobre ventas y neuromárketing.

He tenido unos buenos resultados en cuanto a apertura de mercado, ganando nuevos clientes, y a la fidelización de estos. Basando toda mi estrategia comercial en la búsqueda de la confianza y la honestidad. 

Mis aptitudes y habilidades sociales se vieron incrementadas notablemente, a la par que mi crecimiento personal y profesional.

Durante este periodo he podido desempeñar el puesto de camarero. Habiendo satisfecho con éxito las siguientes exigencias:
- Gestión de inventario
- Gestión de pedidos
- Atención al cliente
- Servicio de cafés y alimentos

Durante este periodo he desempeñado la función de camarero de comedor y sala. Habiendo satisfecho con éxito las siguientes exigencias:
- Atención al cliente
- Servicio de cafés y alimentos

Durante este periodo he podido gestionar el servicio de cafetería del instituto como profesional autónomo. Habiendo satisfecho con éxito las siguientes exigencias:
- Gestión de inventario
- Gestión de pedidos
- Atención al cliente
- Servicio de cafés y alimentos

He participado como actor figurante en la película de producción americana "El apostol Santiago, hijo del trueno". 

Ha sido una experiencia increíble y muy divertida.

Durante todos estos años he trabajado ininterrumpidamente como camarero de extra, cubriendo todo tipo de eventos, normalmente los fines de semana.
- Bodas
- Comuniones
- Bautizos
- Todo tipo de eventos
- Servicio de restaurante a la carta
- Servicio de cafetería

A pesar de ser un trabajo muy duro y que requiere habilidades sociales y mucha paciencia y empatía, es un trabajo que me hace crecer.

details.name: Agile QR restaurant card manager
details.description:
Application for convenient and immediate management of the online menu via QR for businesses in the restaurant sector. Client side adapted for use on mobile devices, mobile control panel and desktop.

Benefits:

- Control of available products on the online menu from the mobile device itself, with 1 click.
- Automatic creation of product descriptions using Artificial Intelligence.
- App instalation directly by click on the agile-qr logo (only on suported devices)
- Translation of products into the selected language with 1 click (In progress, not yet implemented).
- Multi-language (In progress, not yet implemented).
- Instant product updates without the need to refresh the client's page (using websockets, coming implementation).
- Menu customization. Custom logo and more.

Access credentials to the control panel:
User:
example@agileqr.dev

Password:
abc123.

details.name: BlogOnRails
details.description:
As I go deeper into Ruby on Rails I discover many sections that were not easy for me to learn at the beginning. Therefore, I would like to share those "discoveries" with the intention of helping anyone else who is in the process of learning Rails.

This application is going to be a blog about Ruby on Rails and its ecosystem.

Having to write articles, I will have to do a lot of research on the topic beforehand.

construction_worker It will be managed 100% by me, and the informative articles will be written to be easily understood (as much as possible).

My main goal is to make the platform a win/win (users access to interesting information / I learn and practice).

It will consist of the following sections:
- Informative articles about using Ruby on Rails.
- MarkDown + code highlighting
- Articles organized by tags
- User login system
- Internal messaging
- discussion forum
- comments in the articles
- favorites button
- article search bar
- filtered articles by tag
- select theme switch button (dark theme)
- select language (ES/EN)

details.name: Scheduled Tweets
details.description:
PRACTICE PROJECT - SHEDULED TWEETS
The application allows the user to have multiple Twitter accounts and schedule tweets (Who would have thought!) which will be automatically tweeted at the set time.

On this project I have learned:

- OmniAuth:
     - config environments 
     - setting API keys 
- Rails Credentials
    - Using rails credentials:edit to store the Twitter API credentials to development & 
      production 
- Backgroun Jobs
    - Creating a TweetJob 
    - TweetJob.preform_later(@tweet) 
- Sidekiq and Redis
    - Installing and setting up Redis-server
    - Configuring active_job_queue_adapter = :sidekiq 
- Bootstrap 
- Session Cookies 
- PasswordMailer < ApplicationMailer
    - Config environment to be able to reset passwords by email 
- Deploy application 
    - Scheduled Tweets 


It has been a great learning experience. Let's keep going!

details.name: Airbnb clone
details.description:
Being able to see a professional web developer at work (without video cuts) is a very enriching process. I am following TypeFast project on Youtube, taking notes on everything that is new to me, and learning about the actual flow of development:

Have a problem --> Identify the source of the problem --> Know how to find information about the problem --> process the problem --> solve the problem.

(I'm learning A LOT, and i'm pretty happy!)

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription: My ideal job is one in which I am trusted to be able to deploy my full potential, and at the same time have an interest in my personal and professional development. Never stop learning and evolving, so that we can grow together!
manfredSpecificData.goodPractices:
- English:
I am learning TDD (Test Driven Development), and I think it is a very solid methodology
At the same time, I care about writing good code that is readable and applies SOLID and DRY principles. 
I would like to add that I also think it is important to apply conventions established in the official (or unofficial) style guides of each programming language.

I like a job well done.

- Español:
Estoy aprendiendo TDD (Test Driven Development), y creo que es una metodología muy sólida.
Al mismo tiempo, me preocupo por escribir buen código, que sea legible y que aplique los principios SOLID y DRY. 
Me gustaría añadir que también creo que es importante aplicar las convenciones establecidas en las guías de estilo oficiales (o no oficiales) de cada lenguaje de programación.

Me gusta el trabajo bien hecho.
